NE asks:
Are you able to reproduce this using the vanilla 3.1 build, without CC added? 
E.g. show the Properties view, then select a resource in the Navigator?

John replies:
the answer to this question is "Yes"!  I get the NPE at
TreeItem.computeDisplayText, line 280.

I can reproduce the problem without our plug in installed.

First, as a check:
1) start up eclipse m5a/motif on Linux of Solaris (either one)
2) using a simple project with one package and a single java file, I nav all the
way down and open up the java file in the editor.
3) open the Property View (Window -> Show View -> Other -> Basic -> Properties)
4) nothing bad happens.
5) close the tree so that only the project is showing and be sure to close down
the editor.
6) shut down eclipse.

Then (this will show the NPE):
1) start up eclipse again, pointing at the same simple project but do not nav
down or open an editor.
2) open the Property View
3) select the project (which should be closed since it was closed above or if
you start with a newly imported project).
4) I get the NPE in
org.eclipse.swt.widgets.TreeItem.computeDisplayText(TreeItem.java:280)

One more thing... in my first set of steps in "Additional Comment #2", once
"nothing bad happens", you can select anything in the tree without getting a NPE.

John, I can't reproduce the problem here, though I've tried your steps and
several variations.  Some questions about the steps:

In the first set of steps:
Step 2: I cannot create a Simple Project that contains a Package, only a Java
Project can contain a Package.  Is your project a Java Project, or did you mean
something different by "package"?
Step 5: By "close the tree" I assume you mean collapse it, not Close the
Project?

In the second set of steps:
Step 2: When I restart eclipse, the Properties view is already open since it was
left open from the first set of steps.  Should it have been closed previously?

Also, does the perspective that you're working in seem to matter?

closed it in the first set of steps.  I found if I did not close it, then I

Grant,

Regarding your comment about having the properties view open... my most recent
test indicates that it ought to be closed and that the NPE occurs when the prop
view is first opened.  I just ran a test where the prop sheet was opened alread
and all was ok.  Then I closed it, and when I reopened it, I got the npe.  I
also had to recreate my workspace because the one I was using yesterday seemed
to be corrupt... which perhaps led me to my conclusions about whether the
propsheet should be open or closed.
